comment_body: The coverage data shows critical lines are not covered. Could you add more test coverage? #Closed
the description is unclear. please make clear. it is unclear to me why previous calculation is wrong, and what did you do to make it correct.

>                 self.update_state_db(value, 'CMD', cmd)

The 8 DB write could be optimized to 1. #Closed

---
Refers to: scripts/procdockerstatsd:196 in aedadcf. [](commit_id = aedadcf73d316b447b6f278b64464bd2ea020220, deletion_comment = False)

> > ```

[](commit_id = [aedadcf](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/commit/aedadcf73d316b447b6f278b64464bd2ea020220), deletion_comment = False)

Will fix this as separate optimization PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/176 since this change is not cpu utilization change related.
@ganglyu , can you please merge this PR?
LGTM. The test code in sonic-mgmt repo also need to be updated.
Added tag as #137 has been merged to 202405
Hi @abdosi , @gechiang , changed base branch to master. Please review. Thanks

@StormLiangMS Can you please cherry-pick this to 202305?
@qiluo-msft  Can you please help to review?
Hi @qiluo-msft , could you please help review?
No pipelines are associated with this pull request.

I could not understand whether it is a bug or expected that “It means that the delayed service will not be restarted if swss crashes”.
If something is a bug, could you write a unit test or sonic-mgmt testcase?

> I could not understand whether it is a bug or expected that “It means that the delayed service will not be restarted if swss crashes”. If something is a bug, could you write a unit test or sonic-mgmt testcase?

Hi @qiluo-msft , it is not a bug. It is a negative manual test. In this test, we simulate a swss crash and see that some service are down forever even if they are set to always_restart. I suppose the "always_restart" server must have the ability to "self healing" from a crash, so I issued this PR as a fix. What do you think?
The UT failure is caused by PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-host-services/pull/80, pending on a fix or revert
Hi @yxieca, could you please help cherry-pick it?
Could you paste the crash stack? Could you check the coverage? #Closed
@alexrallen @dgsudharsan Please help review this PR? wondering why this is not identified by original testcases? #Closed
